intro: Lepidagathis fasciculata var. major, commonly known as the large-leaved lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clustered, opposite leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
